page.title: 19OPPOSITE BERE FERRERS
page.content: The Maristow side of the river can be approached at low tide by crossing the concrete footbridge or the road ford at Lopwell Dam. The access roads are very steep, but some Plymothians come down at the week-end. The agriculture is large scale arable farming and some dairy farming. There ia a considerable area of marshy land. Maristow House is owned by Lord Roborough and is a family seat,although no longer occupied. It has suffered three fires in its history and the last one, arson,caused damage amounting to 1.5 million pounds. It has been temporarily covered and the house is having woodwork affected by dry rot removed. The only room untouched by the disastrous fire was Lord Roborough's father's study.The surrounding land is used for Scout and Guide camps.
